aig.logs.no_logs: No logs exist for this gateway yet. See the documentation to learn how to send your first request
aig.logs.search.content: Search in the request or response content
aig.title.description: Observe and control your AI applications
aig.new_user.title: Get started by creating an AI Gateway
aig.new_user.description: AI Gateway lets you tunnel your AI requests through Cloudflare so you can get logs, caching, rate-limiting and more. Use different gateways to separate logs, metrics and settings between different applications. You can create as many gateways as you want. Start by creating your first one!
aig.endpoint_modal.title: API Endpoint
aig.endpoint_modal.description: Use this API Endpoint URL to setup a new gateway and connect to your AI applications and platforms.
aig.endpoint_modal.using.title: Example
aig.endpoint_modal.using.description: Use the code snippet below to use the API. For more details look at the Get Started Guide
aig.gateway_modal.title: Add new AI Gateway
aig.gateway_modal.description: Give your gateway a name to easily find it later. Each gateway you create will have a different URL endpoint, different settings and different logs and metrics.
aig.settings.logs.description: Save request and response payload in AI Gateway Real-time logs.
aig.settings.caching.description: AI Gateway can cache responses coming from your AI providers, so the next time you send them you'll get a free answer, faster.
aig.settings.ratelimiting.description: Define your rate-limiting rules to keep your bills under control and prevent abuse.
aig.settings.ratelimiting.configuration: Limit requests when rate exceeds <0/> requests over a  period.
aig.settings.remove_gateway.description: Deleting %{gateway} is permanent and cannot be undone. You will no longer be able to send any requests through it, and all logs and metrics related to it will be lost.
aig.settings.remove_gateway.modal.descri: Are you sure you want to remove this gateway? This cannot be undone.
aig.settings.intro: Settings here will affect your %{gateway} gateway only. Use multiple gateways if you want to have different settings for different applications.
aig.stats.requests: The number of requests made through this AI Gateway over the selected period of time
aig.stats.cache: The number of cached responses provided by this AI Gateway over the selected period of time
aig.stats.tokens: The estimated total number of tokens (from all models and all providers) used by this AI Gateway over the selected period of time
aig.stats.errors: The number of requests that resulted in an error sent from this AI Gateway over the selected period of time
